_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This facility complies with all regulations for the handling and storage of NH3 and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occure, it is our policy to notify the Fenton Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

This facility is a farmer owed cooperative.  We sell agricultural products to memebers and non-members. We sell NH3 for the sole purpose of fertilization of farm ground.  This facility consists of one 30,000 gallon storage tank and 23 nurse tanks (12 - 1500 gallon and 11 - 1000 gallon). 

Our worst case scenario would be the sudden release of the main storage tank when it was filled to capacity.  According to EPA look-up tables, the distance to endpoint would be 4.4 miles with an approximate population of 456 people.  Since this facility is located within the city limits of Fenton, provisions have been designed to notify all affected persons.  An evacutaion plan is in place.

Our alternate scenerio would be the acidental pull-away by a recieving transport unit without disconnecting the transfer hose.  According to EPA look-up tables, the endpoint would be .5 miles with an approximate population of 300 people.  All employees working at this facility have been trained on how to respond to this type of scenerio.

This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rules and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.

We have never had an accident involving NH3 that caused death, injuries, property or enviromental damage or evacuations.

In the event of an emergency at our NH3 plant, it is our policy to noticy the Fenton Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.  We have discussed this policy with the fire department and memeber of the fire department have inspected our NH3 facility.

There are no planned changes of our proceedures or policies.
